(High)

(Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: with_capacity()] [Zero capacity] Can providing capacity=0 create IdSets that immediately panic on any add() call, or does it handle the edge case gracefully? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: with_capacity()] [Maximum capacity] Can capacity values near usize::MAX cause integer overflow in next_power_of_two() or allocation failures with unclear error messages? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: add()] [Capacity boundary] Does the >= comparison in capacity check allow adding exactly capacity elements, or is there an off-by-one error that rejects valid additions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: from_slice()] [Empty slice] Does from_slice(&[]) return Some(empty_idset) or None, and can empty ID sets cause issues in downstream operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proof_with_setup()] [Round bounds] Can extremely large round values cause out-of-bounds access in tau_powers_g1[round] array indexing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proof_with_setup()] [Proof uniqueness] Can two different IDs in the same IdSet produce identical proofs, breaking the uniqueness guarantee required for verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_all_eval_proofs_with_setup()] [Proof completeness] Does the function guarantee that every ID in poly_roots gets a corresponding proof in the HashMap, or can some IDs be silently dropped? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proofs_with_setup()] [ID validation] Does the function validate that all requested IDs exist in poly_roots before generating proofs, or can non-existent IDs produce arbitrary proofs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proof_with_setup()] [Divisor validity] Can the quotient polynomial computation produce incorrect results if the divisor at index_of_id is malformed or zero? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_poly_coeffs()] [Memory leak] Can repeated calls to compute_poly_coeffs() without dropping the ComputedCoeffs result lead to memory leaks with large mult_trees? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_all_eval_proofs_with_setup()] [Temporary allocation] Does proof generation create excessive temporary allocations that cause memory pressure in constrained environments? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Struct: IdSet] [Clone depth] Does cloning IdSet with ComputedCoeffs perform deep clones of the entire mult_tree, and can this cause performance issues or stack overflows? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_poly_coeffs()] [Coeffs synchronization] Can poly_roots be modified after computing coefficients, creating desynchronization between the roots and computed polynomial? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Struct: ComputedCoeffs] [Tree depth invariant] Can the mult_tree depth become inconsistent with poly_roots length, breaking assumptions in quotient computation? (Medium)
